segments.text: I'm just observing this kitchen, and frankly, I'm quite perplexed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can so many things be going wrong simultaneously without anyone noticing?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is completely absorbed in her dish-drying task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn't see the waterfall coming from her sink, or the lake forming at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus is admirable, I suppose, but also incredibly misplaced right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then there are the children, totally engrossed in their cookie acquisition.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're ignoring the danger of the tipping stool and the wet floor just inches away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me want to sigh loudly; it's like a comedy of errors waiting to unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole situation is quite frustrating to watch, really.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can only imagine the chaos that will erupt when the woman finally looks down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to point out the obvious before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Itâ€™s a bizarre tableau of domestic bliss mixed with utter neglect.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just can't fathom how such a simple kitchen can contain so much unseen trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is certainly not what I expected to see today.
segments.speaker: PAR
